data.neighbors

Class NeighborSetFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.neighbors.NeighborSetFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class NeighborSetFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements the functionality for exact kNN search and kNN graph calculations, in various contexts. It also implements the functionality for calculating the neighbor occurrence frequencies, good and bad occurrences, reverse neighbor sets, reverse and direct neighbor set entropies and other hubness-related measures. Functionally, it implements various hubness-based weighting modes and the class-conditional probabilistic model estimates for hubness-aware classification. It is a simple implementation in that the default kNN search and graph construction methods do not rely on additional spatial indexing. The reason for that, though - is that this library is meant primarily for high-dimensional data analysis, where such indexes have been shown to be of little use - and calculating them takes time. In case of large low-to-medium dimensional datasets where spatial indexing can be very useful, alternative implementations should be used. This one is meant for high-dim data instead. Also, in case of large-scale datasets, approximate kNN extensions are to be preferred.
    See Also:

      void completeNeighborSets(int k, java.util.HashMap tabuList)
      If some neighbor sets are incomplete, after the removal of certain neighbor points from neighbor sets and/or maybe wanting to increase k (and after the shifting of the neighbor lists and distance lists to the left) the method reads the kcurrLen array and if some kCurrLen is less than k, it completes it.

      This method calculates an alternative type of weights for the simhub secondary shared-neighbor similarity measure, where each weight is proportional to the estimate of the goodness of the contribution of the shared neighbor to the intra-class similarities and the badness of its contribution to the inter-class similarities.

        public int getCurrK()

      • setDistances

        public void setDistances(float[][] distMatrix)
        Parameters:
        distMatrix - float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix, where the length of each row i is (size - i - 1) and each row contains only the entries for j > i, so that distMatrix[i][j] represents the distance between i and i + j + 1.

      • getGlobalClassToClassForKforBayerisan

        public float[][] getGlobalClassToClassForKforBayerisan(int k,
                                              int numClasses,
                                              float laplaceEstimator,
                                              boolean extendByElement)
        This method calculates the class-to-class neighbor occurrence probability matrix for use in the Bayesian hubness-aware classification models.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        laplaceEstimator - Float value that is the Laplace estimator for distribution smoothing.
        extendByElement - Boolean flag indicating whether to use the query point as its own 0-th nearest neighbor.
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the class-to-class neighbor occurrence probability matrix for use in the Bayesian hubness-aware classification models.

      • getClassDataNeighborRelationForKforBayesian

        public float[][] getClassDataNeighborRelationForKforBayesian(int k,
                                                    int numClasses,
                                                    float laplaceEstimator,
                                                    boolean extendByElement)
        This method calculates the class-conditional neighbor occurrence probability matrix for use in the Bayesian hubness-aware classification models. This means that the values are normalized to represent the probability of neighbor given the class, instead of class given the neighbor.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        laplaceEstimator - Float value that is the Laplace estimator for distribution smoothing.
        extendByElement - Boolean flag indicating whether to use the query point as its own 0-th nearest neighbor.
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the class-conditional neighbor occurrence probability matrix for use in the Bayesian hubness-aware classification models.

        public float[][] getFuzzyClassDataNeighborRelation(int k,
                                          int numClasses,
                                          float laplaceEstimator,
                                          boolean extendByElement)
        This method calculates the class-conditional neighbor occurrence probability matrix for use in the fuzzy hubness-aware classification models. This means that the values are normalized to represent the probability of neighbor given the class, instead of class given the neighbor.

      • getDataClassNeighborRelationNonNormalized

        public float[][] getDataClassNeighborRelationNonNormalized(int k,
                                                  int numClasses,
                                                  boolean extendByElement)
        This method calculates the class-conditional neighbor occurrence counts. In the results, the cell [i,j] holds the occurrence count of point i in class j.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        extendByElement - Boolean flag indicating whether to use the query point as its own 0-th nearest neighbor.
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the class-conditional neighbor occurrence counts. In the results, the cell [i,j] holds the occurrence count of point i in class j.

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object to query.
        instanceIndex - Integer that is the index of the data instance that is the kNN query.
        neighborhoodSize - Integer that is the desired neighborhood size.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        Returns:
        int[] that contains the indexes of the k-nearest neighbors for the query point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIndexesOfNeighbors

        public static int[] getIndexesOfNeighbors(DataSet dset,
                          DataInstance instance,
                          int neighborhoodSize,
                          float[] distances)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method queries the dataset to determine the neighbors of a particular point that does not belong to the dataset.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object to query.
        instance - DataInstance that is the query point.
        neighborhoodSize - Integer that is the desired neighborhood size.
        distances - float[] representing the distances from the query point to the points in the provided DataSet.
        Returns:
        int[] that contains the indexes of the k-nearest neighbors for the query point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIndexesOfNeighbors

        public static int[][] getIndexesOfNeighbors(DataSet trainingDSet,
                            DataSet testDSet,
                            int neighborhoodSize,
                            float[][] testToTrainDist)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the indexes of neighbors from the training set for all the instances in the test set.
        Parameters:
        trainingDSet - DataSet object that is the training data.
        testDSet - DataSet object that is the test data.
        neighborhoodSize - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        testToTrainDist - Float 2D array of distances from test to training.
        Returns:
        Integer 2D array of indexes of neighbors from the training data of points in the test data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public static int[] getIndexesOfNeighbors(DataSet dset,

      • getDataDensitiesByNormalizedRadius

        public static double[] getDataDensitiesByNormalizedRadius(DataSet dset,
                                          CombinedMetric cmet,
                                          int currK,
                                          int[][] kNeighbors)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method calculates an estimate of the data density in all data points based on their nearest neighbors and the kNN radius.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object that the points belong to.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.

        public static double[] getDataDensitiesByNormalizedRadiusForElementsUntil(DataSet dset,
                                                          CombinedMetric cmet,
                                                          int currK,
                                                          int[][] kNeighbors,
                                                          int maxPointIndex)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception

        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        currK - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        kNeighbors - int[][] that is an array of neighbor index arrays for all data points.
        maxPointIndex - Integer that is the maximum index to calculate the densities for.

        double[] containing the estimated point-wise densities.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • calculateHubnessStats

        public void calculateHubnessStats(boolean recalculateOccurrences)
        This method calculates the occurrence frequency (total, good, bad) means and standard deviations.
        Parameters:

      • tabuANeighbor

        public void tabuANeighbor(int tNeighborIndex,
                 int tVal,
                 java.util.HashMap tabuList,
                 boolean calculateHubnessStatistics)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the users to eliminate a particular neighbor point from all calculated kNN sets. This can be used in cases of instance selection, when certain points are removed from the prototype set.
        Parameters:
        tNeighborIndex - Integer that is the index of the neighbor point to eliminate from all neighbor sets.
        tVal - Integer that is the value to put in the tabu hashmap alongside the neighbor index.
        tabuList - HashMap that is the list of all banned neighbors.
        calculateHubnessStatistics - Boolean flag indicating whether to recalculate the mean / stDev after each tabu run.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • completeNeighborSets

        public void completeNeighborSets(int k,
                        java.util.HashMap tabuList)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        If some neighbor sets are incomplete, after the removal of certain neighbor points from neighbor sets and/or maybe wanting to increase k (and after the shifting of the neighbor lists and distance lists to the left) the method reads the kcurrLen array and if some kCurrLen is less than k, it completes it. also, if k is greater than the length of the neighbor lists, a new matrix is generated, the arrays are extended. All occurrence-stats calculations are performed after the kNN recalculations. This method also takes as a parameter a tabu list (or rather, a tabu map) that marks certain points as 'forbidden' and they are not considered as potential neighbors during re-calculations.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        tabuList - HashMap that contains the forbidden elements, those which are not to be considered as potential neighbors.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • calculateNeighborSetsMultiThr

        public void calculateNeighborSetsMultiThr(int k,
                                 int numThreads,
                                 boolean[] isAllowed)
        This method calculates the k-nearest neighbor sets in a multi-threaded way.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        numThreads - Integer that is the number of threads to use.
        isAllowed - boolean[] that states whether a certain point is allowed to be considered as neighbor in the given context.

      • calculateNeighborSetsMultiThr

        public void calculateNeighborSetsMultiThr(int k,
                                 int numThreads)
        This method calculates the k-nearest neighbor sets in a multi-threaded way.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        numThreads - Integer that is the number of threads to use.

      • getNeighborOccFrequencies

        public int[] getNeighborOccFrequencies(int kSmall)
        This method calculates the neighbor occurrence frequencies for some neighborhood size that is less than equal to the currently calculated size of the neighbor sets.
        Parameters:
        kSmall - Integer that is the neighborhood size to calculate the neighbor occurrence frequencies for. It needs to be smaller than the current length of kNN sets.
        Returns:
        int[] representing the neighbor occurrence frequencies.

      • considerNeighbor

        public void considerNeighbor(int neighborIndex,
                    boolean batchUpdateStats)
        This method is used for incremental neighbor inclusions in incremental instance selection. It assumes the kNN sets and other structures are already initialized and filled with some initial points. It extends the existing kNN sets by the specified neighbor point where possible if it was not already included and updates the stats. If the neighbor sets do not already exist, the method will break. It is meant to be used in this very specific context.
        Parameters:
        neighborIndex - Integer that is the index of the point to consider as a neighbor for extending the existing neighbor sets with.
        batchUpdateStats - Boolean flag indicating whether to perform an update of the occurrence stats as well after the insertion. If multiple insertions are to be made, then it is possible to leave this object in inconsistent intermediate states and only update after the last insertion, which would yield a significant speed-up.

      • calculateNeighborSets

        public void calculateNeighborSets(int k)
        This method calculates the k-nearest neighbor sets.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.

      • calculateNeighborSets

        public void calculateNeighborSets(int k,
                         float[] distanceCorrections)
        This method calculates the k-nearest neighbor sets, by also allowing for distance corrections towards certain points. These corrections are sometimes used in kNN variations for classification under class imbalance and this method makes it possible to use them directly in kNN search without having to modify the entire distance matrix. The corrections are usually used for subtracting the radius to the closest 'enemy' point.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size.
        distanceCorrections - float[] representing the distance corrections to be subtracted from the actual distances to the points in kNN calculations.

      • getFrequentAtLeast

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getFrequentAtLeast(int thresholdFrequency)
                                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns the indexes of neighbor points that exceed the specified occurrence frequency on the training data.
        Parameters:
        thresholdFrequency - Integer that is the threshold frequency.
        Returns:
        List of indexes of neighbor points that exceed a certain occurrence frequency on the training data.
        Throws:

        Returns:

      • getHWKNNWeightingScheme

        public float[] getHWKNNWeightingScheme()
        Returns:
        float[] representing the exponential weights based on the standardized bad neighbor occurrence frequency scores. This weighting scheme was first used for vote weighting in hw-kNN, that was proposed by Radovanovic and Nanopulous.

      • getMaxedAtOneHWKNNWeightingScheme

        public float[] getMaxedAtOneHWKNNWeightingScheme()
        Returns:
        float[] representing the exponential weights based on the standardized bad neighbor occurrence frequency scores, with a maximum value of 1 for each weight, achieved via cut-off. This is a slight modification of the weighting that scheme was first used for vote weighting in hw-kNN, proposed by Radovanovic and Nanopulous.

      • getBoundedGoodMinusBadHubnessWeightingScheme

        public float[] getBoundedGoodMinusBadHubnessWeightingScheme()
        Returns:
        float[] representing the bounded weights derived from the difference between good and bad neighbor occurrence frequency for each point.

      • calculateKEntropies

        public void calculateKEntropies(int numCategories,
                       int neighborhoodSize)
        Calculates k-entropies, which measure how mixed the labels are in the k-neighborhoods of points
        Parameters:
        numCategories - Integer representing the number of classes in the data.
        neighborhoodSize - Integer that is the neighborhood size to use for calculating the k-entropies. It has to be lower than the k of the current k-NN sets.

      • recalculateStatsForSmallerK

        public void recalculateStatsForSmallerK(int kSmall)
        This method re-calculates the occurrence stats for a smaller neighborhood size. This way, one NeighborSetFinder object can be used to derive the neighbor stats for any k-value up until the length of the calculated kNN sets. The operating k value is saved to the currK variable.
        Parameters:
        kSmall - Integer that is the smaller neighborhood size.

      • getSimhubAlternateWeights01

        public float[] getSimhubAlternateWeights01()
        This method calculates an alternative type of weights for the simhub secondary shared-neighbor similarity measure, where each weight is either 0 or 1, depending on how the total shared-neighbor contribution of the neighbor point is judged. More details are available in the original paper.
        Returns:
        float[] representing a 0-1 type of weights for shared-neighbor distances.

      • getSimhubAlternateWeightsGoodnessProportional

        public float[] getSimhubAlternateWeightsGoodnessProportional(int k)
        This method calculates an alternative type of weights for the simhub secondary shared-neighbor similarity measure, where each weight is proportional to the estimate of the goodness of the contribution of the shared neighbor to the intra-class similarities and the badness of its contribution to the inter-class similarities.
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the current neighborhood size.
        Returns:
        float[] representing a goodness-proportional shared-neighbor weights.

      • getSimhubAlternateWeightsGoodnessProportional

        public float[] getSimhubAlternateWeightsGoodnessProportional()
        This method calculates an alternative type of weights for the simhub secondary shared-neighbor similarity measure, where each weight is proportional to the estimate of the goodness of the contribution of the shared neighbor to the intra-class similarities and the badness of its contribution to the inter-class similarities.
        Returns:
        float[] representing a goodness-proportional shared-neighbor weights.

      • getLabelMismatchPercsAllK

        Returns:

      • getKCooccurrences

        public float[][] getKCooccurrences(int kVal)
        Parameters:
        kVal - Integer that is the neighborhood size to do the calculations for.
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the upper triangular matrix of neighbor co-occurrence counts. The matrix value at i,j represents the co-occurrence count of point i and i + j + 1.
